May 22, 1994: Fiction
REMEMBER ME, by Mary Higgins Clark. (Simon & Schuster, $23.50.) After an
estranged couple reconcile, they find themselves haunted by a mysterious force.
THE CELESTINE PROPHECY, by James Redfield. (Warner, $17.95.) An ancient
manuscript, found in Peru, provides insights into achieving a fulfilling life.
INCA GOLD, by Clive Cussler. (Simon & Schuster, $24.) Dirk Pitt contends with a
ring of thieves for possession of ancient artifacts in the Peruvian Andes.
"K" IS FOR KILLER, by Sue Grafton. (Holt, $22.95.) Kinsey Millhone investigates
the strange death of a waitress's daughter.
THE DAY AFTER TOMORROW, by Allan Folsom. (Little, Brown, $24.95.) A
young doctor, haunted by his father's murder, stumbles into a tangle of
international conspiracies.
THE BRIDGES OF MADISON COUNTY, by Robert James Waller. (Warner,
$16.95.) A photographer and a lonely farmer's wife in Iowa.
ACCIDENT, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $23.95.) A car collision involving four
teen-agers tragically alters the lives of five families.
LIKE WATER FOR CHOCOLATE, by Laura Esquivel. (Doubleday, $17.50.)
Frustration, love, hope -- and recipes -- sampled by a woman on a Mexican ranch.
THE ALIENIST, by Caleb Carr. (Random House, $22.) A journalist and a
psychologist track down a murderer in turn-of-the-century Manhattan.
LOVERS, by Judith Krantz. (Crown, $23.) Romance, rivalry and fun among half a
dozen couples.
THE FIST OF GOD, by Frederick Forsyth. (Bantam, $23.95.) Spies, traitors and
brave warriors at work during the Persian Gulf war.
SLOW WALTZ IN CEDAR BEND, by Robert James Waller. (Warner, $16.95.)
From Iowa to India: the romance of a professor and a colleague's wife.
CHARADE, by Sandra Brown. (Warner, $21.95.) Following a heart transplant
operation, a television host finds her life enriched -- and threatened.
DISCLOSURE, by Michael Crichton. (Knopf, $24.) A computer-industry executive
rejects the advances of his boss and is accused by her of sexual harassment.
DAYBREAK, by Belva Plain. (Delacorte, $22.95.) Two families are divided and
then united by a series of surprising developments.
Non-Fiction
EMBRACED BY THE LIGHT, by Betty J. Eadie with Curtis Taylor. (Gold Leaf
Press, $16.95.) A woman's near-death experience.
REBA: My Story, by Reba McEntire with Tom Carter. (Bantam, $22.95.) The
autobiography of the country singer.
THE BOOK OF VIRTUES, by William J. Bennett. (Simon & Schuster, $27.50.)
Moral stories adapted from the Greeks, the Bible, folklore and elsewhere.
MIDNIGHT IN THE GARDEN OF GOOD AND EVIL, by John Berendt. (Random
House, $23.) The mysterious death of a young man in Savannah, Ga.
OLD SONGS IN A NEW CAFE, by Robert James Waller. (Warner, $16.95.)
Nineteen essays dealing with his memories by a novelist-photographer-musician.
STANDING FIRM, by Dan Quayle. (HarperCollins/Zondervan, $25.) The former
Vice President recalls his life, especially during the Bush years.
BEYOND PEACE, by Richard Nixon. (Random House, $23.) An agenda of foreign
and domestic policies for the United States to pursue in the post-cold war era.
HAVING OUR SAY, by Sarah and A. Elizabeth Delany with Amy Hill Hearth.
(Kodansha, $20.) Two black sisters, both of them over 100, reflect on their lives.
SAVED BY THE LIGHT, by Dannion Brinkley with Paul Perry. (Villard, $16.) An
account of two near-death experiences by a South Carolina businessman.
HOW WE DIE, by Sherwin B. Nuland. (Knopf, $24.) A physician and surgeon
reflects on "life's final chapter."
WOULDN'T TAKE NOTHING FOR MY JOURNEY NOW, by Maya Angelou.
(Random House, $17.) Essays about life and death, good and evil.
DIPLOMACY, by Henry Kissinger. (Simon & Schuster, $35.) Ways in which the art
of diplomacy and the balance of power have shaped the world we live in.
THE HIDDEN LIFE OF DOGS, by Elizabeth Marshall Thomas. (Davison/Houghton
Mifflin, $18.95.) An analysis of canine behavior.
SOUL MATES, by Thomas Moore. (HarperCollins, $25.) A psychotherapist
discusses love and relationships.
ZLATA'S DIARY, by Zlata Filipovic. (Viking, $16.95.) The diary kept by a girl living
in war-torn Sarajevo, from 1991 (when she was 11 years old) to 1993.
